newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks rocket amid rate cut, EMU hopes.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks rocket amid rate cut, EMU hopes.

text.p: Madrid stocks rocketed to new highs in busy trade on Tuesday, fuelled by a heavy inflow of domestic funds from the bond market in a euphoric climate, dealers said.
The general index rose 5.70 points, 1.40 percent, to 411.42 and the Ibex added 73.68 points, 1.57 percent, to 4,757.18.
Spain's expected entry into EMU and an influx of funds from the debt market were supporting the rise, according to analysts.
They added that forecast lower money rates also helped, hence investors were focusing on motorways and some utilities.
Iberdrola rose 70 pesetas to 1,605 and Fenosa added 55 pesetas to 1,055. Motorways Acesa and Aumar were also up strongly.
Gas Natural was of the few to end lower after the government fixed a 26,000 peseta price for its oversubscribed 3.8 percent stake. The stock shed 120 pesetas to 26,380.
So far any chance of a correction was being ruled out by an overwhelming appetite for stocks.
"One key factor is the reallocation of money from debt funds to equities," said one analyst.
This may well sustain gains until the end of the year.
